purpleculture_pinyin:
zòng
warp (the vertical threads in weaving); vertical; longitudinal; north-south (lines of longitude); lengthwise; to release; to indulge; even if
основа (вертикальные нити в ткачестве); вертикальный; продольный; север-юг (линии долготы); по длине; освободить; предаваться; даже если
rtega_mnemonic:
縱縱RS
纵纵		𦂵縦vertical, length, height, self-indulgent, wayward
  • follow 從 one's own line 糸: be self-indulgent and put one's back as vertical as possible to show one's length or height

(Simplified: 纵)
Antonyms: 橫
Pictophonetic: 從 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
縱橫 [ zòng héng ]: lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal; length and breadth; criss-crossed; able to move unhindered; abbr. for 合纵连横 , School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
縱然 [ zòng rán ]: even if; even though
縱深 [ zòng shēn ]: depth (from front to rear); depth (into a territory); span (of time); (fig.) depth (of deployment, progress, development etc)
縱隊 [ zòng duì ]: column; file; Classifiers: 列

heisig_chinese_memo: The hard part about following Spiderman is when he starts moving vertically.
Ru_trainchinese:
zòng: (глаг/сущ) отпускать, освобождать; давать волю; подпрыгивать; (диал.) мяться, морщиться; (воен.) колонна, корпус
zòng: (прил) по меридиану, с севера на юг; вдоль, с начала до конца чего-л.; с древних времен
zòng: (союз) (книжн.) даже если, пусть даже
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To be efficient the assembly lines run vertically in the thread factories so no space is wasted.
humanum_full_description_en:
The word " Zong " from "糸", in ancient times and " Zong " have similar sound and meaning, which means a kind of silk fabric. Perhaps because silk fabrics are woven from straight and horizontal threads, " longitudinal " later means " straight ", which is opposite to " horizontal ". " Zong " also means release, "Shuowen": "Zong, slow. One says she is. Congshi, Congsheng."

Bronze as " Zong " might be " vertical " in Chinese, because the inscriptions on the " from " under the " stop " is " from " the provincial body, all words from " Shito ", " from " provincial sound. The meaning of the inscriptions is unknown, and the Bear Festival of Death: "Deadness (Zong) Yicheng".

The " Zong " from " Shito ", " from " sound, the original meaning is a pattern of fabric can be used as lace clothing. "Said the text": "Zao, the genus. Cong Shi Cong Cong Sheng Sheng."
humanum_short_description_en: " Zong " from "糸", " Cong " sound, the original meaning is a kind of silk. The original meaning is to release and slow down.
humanum_full_description:
「縱」字從「糸」，古時與「總」音義皆近，表示一種絲織品。可能由於絲織品是由直線和橫線編織而成，故「縱」後來表示「直」，與「橫」相對。「縱」又表示釋放，《說文》：「縱，緩也。一曰舍也。从糸，從聲。」

　　金文作「緃」，可能是「縱」的異體，因為金文上「从」下「止」是「從」的省體，全字從「糸」，「從」省聲。金文用義不詳，亡縱熊節：「亡緃(縱)一乘」。

　　而「緃」從「糸」，「從」聲，本義是有花紋的布料，可作為裝飾衣服的花邊。《說文》：「緃，䋐屬。从糸从從省聲。」
humanum_short_description: 「縱」從「糸」，「從」聲，本義是一種絲織品。一說本義是釋放、放緩。

縱然 [ zòng rán ]: even if; even though
縱深 [ zòng shēn ]: depth (from front to rear); depth (into a territory); span (of time); (fig.) depth (of deployment, progress, development etc)

縱縱RS
纵纵 		𦂵 縦 vertical, length, height, self-indulgent, wayward
  • follow 從 one's own line 糸: be self-indulgent and put one's back as vertical as possible to show one's length or height
(Simplified: 纵)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 橫
Pictophonetic: 從 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 從 [ cóng ] from, by, since, whence, through
①放：縱虎歸山。縱火。
②放任；不拘束：放縱。縱目四望。縱情。縱觀全局。
③身體猛然向前或向上：縱身。
④即使：縱然。縱使。縱令。
⑤豎，直，南北的方向，與“橫”相對：縱橫交錯。縱橫捭闔(指在政治、外交上運用手段進行聯合或分化)。縱貫。縱深。
⑥起皺紋：縱花(用有皺紋的紙做成的花)。這張紙都縱了。
⑦指連隊編制上的“縱隊”。
⑧擒橫。

「 縱 」字從「 糸 」，古時與「 總 」音義皆近，表示一種絲織品。可能由於絲織品是由直線和橫線編織而成，故「 縱 」後來表示「 直 」，與「 橫 」相對。「 縱 」又表示釋放，《說文》：「縱，緩也。一曰舍也。从糸，從聲。」 金文作「 緃 」，可能是「 縱 」的異體，因為金文上「 从 」下「 止 」是「 從 」的省體，全字從「 糸 」，「 從 」省聲。金文用義不詳，亡縱熊節：「亡緃(縱)一乘」。 而「 緃 」從「 糸 」，「 從 」聲，本義是有花紋的布料，可作為裝飾衣服的花邊。《說文》：「緃，䋐屬。从糸从從省聲。」
The word " Zong" from " 糸", in ancient times and " Zong" have similar sound and meaning, which means a kind of silk fabric. Perhaps because silk fabrics are woven from straight and horizontal threads, " longitudinal" later means " straight", which is opposite to " horizontal". " Zong" also means release, "Shuowen": "Zong, slow. One says she is. Congshi, Congsheng." Bronze as " Zong" might be " vertical" in Chinese, because the inscriptions on the " from" under the " stop" is " from" the provincial body, all words from " Shito", " from" provincial sound. The meaning of the inscriptions is unknown, and the Bear Festival of Death: "Deadness (Zong) Yicheng". The " Zong" from " Shito", " from" sound, the original meaning is a pattern of fabric can be used as lace clothing. "Said the text": "Zao, the genus. Cong Shi Cong Cong Sheng Sheng."

縱字的基本解释

縱
zòng

縱
zǒng
均见“纵”。

縱字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zòng］
［《廣韻》子用切，去用，精。］
亦作“縦1”。“纵1”的繁体字。
(1)发；放。
(2)释放。
(3)放纵；听任。
(4)广泛地；任意地。
(5)腾跃。
(6)纵令；即使。
[②]［zòng］
［《廣韻》即容切，平鍾，精。］
“從2”的今字。亦作“縦2”。“纵2”的繁体字。
(1)直。与“横”相对。
(2)“合縱”的节缩语。
(3)通“蹤”。踪迹。
(4)通“蹤”。追随；追逐。
[③]［zǒng］
［《集韻》祖動切，上蕫，精。］
亦作“縦3”。
(1)见“縱3縱”。
(2)通“總”。掌握；统率。
(3)通“總”。古代的一种丝织品。
[④]［zǒng］
［《集韻》足勇切，上腫，精。］
亦作“縦4”。
见“縱4臾”。

縱字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　縱； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页935第31
〔古文〕?【廣韻】子用切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】足用切，?蹤去聲。【說文】緩也。一曰舍也。【博雅】置也。【玉篇】恣也，放也。【書·太甲】縱敗禮。【詩·大雅】無縱詭隨。　又【詩·鄭風】抑縱送忌。【註】發矢曰縱。　又【禮·仲尼燕居】縱言至于禮。【註】縱言，汎說事。　又【左傳·襄二十六年】敢有二心乎。縱有，共其內，莫共其外。　又【爾雅·釋詁】縱，亂也。　又省作從。【論語】從之純如也。【前漢·王吉傳】放從自若。　又【集韻】【韻會】祖動切【正韻】作孔切，?音總。【禮·檀弓】喪事欲其縱縱爾。【註】讀如總領之總。急遽趨事貌。　又【集韻】足勇切，音䙕。慫或作縱。【前漢·衡山王傳】日夜縱臾。【註】師古曰：縱臾，謂獎勸也。　又【廣韻】卽容切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】將容切，?音蹤。【廣韻】縱橫也。【韻會】或作從。【詩·齊風】衡從其畝。【類篇】東西曰衡，南北曰從。【賈誼·過秦論】合從締交。【註】從，與縱同。　又與蹤通。【前漢·蕭何傳】發縱指示獸處者，人也。【註】師古曰：

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zòng］
["Guangyun" sub-use cut, use, fine. ]
Also known as "Xi 1". Traditional characters of "Vertical 1".
(1) Issue; release.
(2) Release.
(3) Indulge; let it go.
(4) Broadly; arbitrarily.
(5) Leap.
(6) Indulgence; even.
[②]［zòng］
["Guangyun" is Rongqi, Pingzhong, Jing. ]
The present character of "from 2". Also known as "Fu 2". Traditional Chinese characters for "Vertical 2".
(1) Straight. Contrast with "horizontal".
(2) The abbreviation of "Hezong".
(3) Through "tracking". trace.
(4) Through "tracking". Follow; chase.
[③] [zǒng]
["Jiyun" ancestor cut, stirrup, fine. ]
Also known as "Xiang 3".
(1) See "Vertical 3 Vertical".
(2) Through "total". Master; command.
(3) Through "general". An ancient silk fabric.
[④]［zǒng］
["Jiyun" feet are cut bravely, swollen on the top, fine. ]
Also known as "縦4".
See "Vertical 4".
